definitions.definition: used in questions to ask about the name, identity or function of one or more people

examples.text: I wonder who that letter was from.

definitions.definition: used to show which person or people you mean

examples.text: The people who called yesterday want to buy the house.
The people (who) we met in France have sent us a card.

definitions.definition: used to give more information about somebody

examples.text: Mrs Smith, who has a lot of teaching experience at junior level, will be joining the school in September.
And then Mary, who we had been talking about earlier, walked in.

definitions.definition: used to ask what right or authority somebody has to do something

examples.text: Who are you to tell me I can't park here?

wordOrigin: Old English hwā, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch wie and German wer.
